definition[0]: anxious behaviour or activity that is usually about unimportant things
example[0]: James said he’d better be getting back or there’d be a fuss.
example[1]: The Steamatic enables you to clean any carpet with the minimum of fuss.
definition[1]: attention or excitement that is usually unnecessary or unwelcome
example[2]: They wanted a quiet wedding without any fuss.
example[3]: Until I heard her sing I couldn’t see what all the fuss was about (=why people liked it so much).
definition[2]: to worry a lot about things that may not be very important
example[4]: I wish you’d stop fussing – I’ll be perfectly all right.
definition[3]: to pay too much attention to small unimportant details
example[5]: Paul was fussing with his clothes, trying to get his tie straight.
definition[4]: to behave in an unhappy or angry way
example[6]: The baby woke up and started to fuss.
